intro: Galium amorginum, commonly known as the Amorgos bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually have a hairy texture. Galium amorginum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments.
